result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeffery Sharod Andrews

records.addlTxt: Statewide. Signed by RMW on 06/09/22. arc     c: SCSO with complaint. e; DA and

CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Liddle ADA:   Holly Elkin Rockow, NONA by def. Case called at 9:54 a.m. Court notes this matter is set for a status conference. DE does not appear. Was scheduled at 9:30 a.m. State requesting a warrant. Court due to non appearance, Court will issue warrant STATEWIDE. Court adjourned at 9:56 a.m.
P/C from DE stating he is working a few hours away and can't get to court today, would like to reschedule.  JA advised court needs something in writing and provided DE with fax number.

* AMENDED * 

- Pre signed waiver of extradition

- DE may be released. Must posting $100.00 by the end of business on 06/03/22. Balance to be paid by July 2, 2022

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, K.D.K-F. and L.M.J.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

-   It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Wal Mart and Dollar Tree in New Richmond, WI.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Liddle ADA:   Holly Elkin Rockow   DF ATTY: Kaitlin Dippolito and  Derek W Sanders   DF:  Jeffery Sharod Andrews appeared from jail via video. Case called at 1:17 p.m. Court notes this matter was reset to today. Atty Dippolito states DE can post $100.00 today. Court will amend bond.

CO: RMW , REP: Kathy Malsom via zoom, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:   Holly Elkin Rockow   DF ATTY: Kaitlin Dippolito and Jeremiah James Harrelson for purposes of today only   DF:  Jeffery Sharod Andrews appeared from jail via video. Case called at 1:19 p.m. DE has a copy of complaint. Address and DOB confirmed. Understands charges and penalties. Atty Dippolito waives further reading. Does not qualify for PD services. Given PFAC. Atty Dippolito makes formal motion to dismiss based on no Victims listed in complaint. ADA Rockow responds. Court will reserve on motion to dismiss. Court enters a NG plea on behalf and preserves all pre plea rights.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for June 2, 2022 at 01:00 pm.  Status conference scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 09:30 am.
